text: ELEN3014 – Modelling Tutorial 2 2023 1 Modelling Tutorial 2 – first and second order LTI systems 1 Second Order System Response The human body’s perception or ‘feeling’ of physical pain can be modelled as shown in Figure 1.1. This perception can be considered as the brain’s interpretation of a physical stimulus received by pain receptors in the skin. Figure 1.1: A model for the human feeling of physical pain a) Calculate an expression for the ‘feeling’ of pain experienced by a person due to a single pin prick. (Hint: you can model the pin prick as an impulse function.) b) How long after the pin prick event does the brain register a maximum ‘feeling’ of pain? c) Draw a graph showing the change in the intensity of the pain experienced due to and after the pin prick event. Show the calculations for a few points on the graph that you used to determine the shape of the graph. d) Draw a graph of the pain experienced by a person due to three consecutive pin pricks, spaced 10 s apart.
